section: This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement and shall terminate on December 31, 2020, unless terminated earlier in accordance with Section 3.2.
explanation: The sentence is missing a verb between "Agreement" and "and shall terminate". This makes the sentence grammatically incorrect and unclear, creating an ambiguity about the intended meaning. The phrase "Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement" is structurally flawed.

section: This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement and shall terminate on December 31, 2020, unless terminated earlier in accordance with Section 3.2.
explanation: The Effective Date is stated as November 1, 2019, but Section 3.1 states the agreement terminates on December 31, 2020. This provides a term of only 14 months. If the intention was to terminate it at a later date then the termination date should reflect that.

section: The Parties hereby irrevocably submit any disputes under this Agreement to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts located in Tel-Aviv, Israel, provided however, that Recipient shall be entitled to seek an injunction or other appropriate remedy against Provider in the country in which Provider has acted in breach of the terms hereof.
explanation: The clause states that disputes are under the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts located in Tel-Aviv, Israel, but also allows the Recipient to seek an injunction or other appropriate remedy against Provider in the country in which Provider has acted in breach. This creates a contradiction, because if the Recipient seeks an injunction or other appropriate remedy against Provider in another country, that means the courts in that country are being used which would not make Tel-Aviv the exclusive jurisdiction for disputes.
